message: If you drive a lot like I do this is a nice app to save you some money.(to save up towards your iPad 2 or iPhone 5 purchase) :P     http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/gasbuddy-find-cheap-gas-prices/id406719683?mt=8
Gas is 3.50+ here so this will come in handy. Once I use it I'll throw a review up.
Mover+, extremely versatile n fun way to transfer files between idevices n Mac/PC over wifi or Bluetooth
@shahabmirzaei Thanks. Great recommendation. I'm in the habit of ignoring apps like this because they don't work in my area, but this one does.
GasBuddy is a very cool app. It actually does gives several different choices of gas stations and I've found the prices to be up to date. A for me.
Check out Planets. Awesome app, one of my must have picks. 100% free no ads http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/planets/id305793334?mt=8
@Lyle thank you for recommending Planets. I just downloaded it and am impressed with it.
The new update to pulse makes it worth wild. More feeds plus they've set up tabs
Which app do mean called pulse. I looked for it and could not find it.
@marle Too early to tell. I love Tweetbot so far, but it still has to pass two tests. I'll report back and discuss on this weeks podcast.

@justinluey looking forward to the podcast as always.  Still trying to train myself to remember to double tap links. They managed to fit so much in the app. I didn't have a chance to see what the last update might have included I'm assuming only bug fixes and nothing significant like push, etc.
